thread.title: Beauty blogger's fringe-cutting hack goes wrong
thread.title_full: Beauty blogger's fringe-cutting hack goes wrong

title: Beauty blogger's fringe-cutting hack goes wrong
text: Share this article Share She believes the clippers will be more 'efficient' than a pair of scissors for the task at hand - despite admitting it will be the first time she's used them to cut her fringe. 'I'm scared,' exclaims Lady D, who has some 33,000 Instagram followers, as she gets started. Disaster: YouTuber Envydeladyd , from France, can be seen attempting to chop her own fringe in the excruciating 30-second clip - but instead ends up with an uneven curtain of hair Lady D says she believes the clippers will be more 'efficient' than a pair of scissors for the task at hand - despite admitting it will be the first time she's used them to cut her fringe However she is left with a shockingly wonky fringe and clumps of hair sticking out at a 90-degree angle. Luckily, Lady D manages to repair the damage thanks to some clever styling with a comb, hairdryer and straighteners - eventually concluding that it's 'not too bad'. Instagram is awash with so-called 'DIY fringe' videos, where vloggers simply hold a section of hair forward in front of their face before twisting the ends together and snipping - making it look all too easy. The look of regret: Lady D's face falls as she is left with a shockingly wonky fringe and clumps of hair sticking out at a 90-degree angle - but the clip has earned her a legion of fans Bad hair day: Lady D's video, entitled Couper sa frange comme sur Instagram (Crazy test: Cutting your fringe the Instagram way ), has already been viewed almost 400,000 times Philadelphia-based make-up artist Camila Bravo went viral last year after giving herself perfect side bangs within seconds in one such clip. Lady D's video, entitled Couper sa frange comme sur Instagram ( Crazy test: Cutting her fringe the Instagram way ), has been viewed almost 400,000 times in just a matter of weeks. Taking to social media yesterday, she wrote: 'My God my video gone round the world Lmfo.' Read more: Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
